passage_text: The president of the US during the Civil War was Abraham Lincoln. For most of the war it was Abraham Lincoln (1809-1865), who proclaimed that the conflict was ultimately intended to preserve the Union of the United States. Actual hostilities began a month after his inauguration, on April 12, 1861.
